lines.text: Where'd you git this gun?
At the gittin' place.
What the hell are you doing?
Just sittin' here.
If this rain hits hard, there's gonna be a river come down through here like a train. You thought about that?
You ain't never been struck by lightning. You don't know what it's like.
You're gonna get drowned sittin' there.
Why that's all right, I ain't never been drowned before.
Well...I say no more.
In the end, Mr. Cole...
...we all get cured of our sentiments.
Those whom life doesn't cure...
...death will.
You're just a deadhead. Just tell me one thing. What the hell would we want you with us for?
'Cause I'm an American.
[first lines]
You ever think about dyin'?
Yeah. You?
Yeah.
So, you think there's a heaven?
Yeah. Don't you?
I don't know. Yeah, maybe. You think you can believe there's a heaven if you don't believe in hell?
I guess you can believe what you want to.
Some crazy people can say that God is here. But God is not here. Everybody knows that God is not here.
Lacey once asked me if I though God looks out for people. I guess he does. I say He's just about got to. I don't believe we'd make it a day, otherwise.
Mister I got trouble you never even heard of.
I guess the country lasts forever, people ain't but for a little while.

[dreaming]
What's it like being dead?
It ain't like nothin' at all.

[to Raul]
I'm not going to kill you. I'm not like you.
In all the years I've been sitting on this bench I heard a lots of things that give me grave doubts about the human race. This ain't one of them.
[last lines]
I thought you might want your old horse back.
Damn, bud.
